Reviews.Title: “I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: PGA2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of bump on Iberia. I really liked the place. Nice room. Bed was like a rock but otherwise room was fine. Walked to a nice restaurant down the street too. It's really close to Barajas and has a convenient shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Very unfriendly reception”
Reviews.Author: acrobateip
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Melia Barajas very tired after 22 hours in airports and on the LAN flight from Lima to Madrid that was severely delayed. I was sent to the Melia Barajas to spend the night because I had missed my connecting flight and the next one wasn't until the following day. The treatment I received from Señora Sole at the front desk was very curt as she shunned me off to one of the other staff, who fortunately were much nicer. I had been told by the airline that it was better if left my bags checked in at the airport for the next flight rather than picking them up and rechecking them, and everything I would need would be available at the hotel, which is rated 4 stars. I asked Señora Soles for a toothbrush and a comb, and she only gave me a toothbrush. When I said that the airline had told me that I didn't need my bags because the hotel would supply these things, she responded rudely that they didn't have combs. Her attitude bothered me more than the fact that they didn't have any combs. If she had apologized and said they had unfortunately run out, I would not be writing this review. Although I do find it surprising that a 4 star hotel doesn't have combs for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive! Plus a free shuttle...”
Reviews.Author: Geem1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was situated close to the airport and our flight was at an awkward time. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus which leaves at various times depending on the time of day. When we went to check out at 4.30am, the staff made sure that the bus driver waited while we completed the check-out process and helped us take our luggage to the minibus. The hotel itself is very impressive with a large entrance, numerous conference rooms and a lovely bar and restaurant. The rooms looked very elegant although the walls were quite thin and unfortunately the people in the next room had the TV on quite loud, quite late. We didn’t bother complaining to reception but I imagine if we had complained then they would have sorted it out for us. There are numerous restaurants in the area and the metro stop is only around 15mins walking distance. I would recommend this hotel if you need accommodation close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Support”
Reviews.Author: Superscricciolina
Reviews.Content: Located close to the Airport (free shuttle every 15 minutes) and to the BUS/Metro station for a short visit of Madrid also during a business trip waiting for the flight the day after. Clean and comfortable room, with modern bathroom and free wifi! Great buffet for breakfast and very nice people supporting you on everything you need!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean & functional hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: ZT100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the best location for exploring Madrid, but is good for the airport. The location is near the centre of the town of Barajas with bars, restaurants etc. It is a spacious hotel with good clean rooms that are of a decent size. I find the staff very helpful and the facilities are good too including the bar/restaurant. There is a free shuttle bus from the airport, you will probably need to call the hotel if it is not already at the airport. The number for the hotel is displayed at the bus stop outside arrivals. All in all, a good hotel with good service, but not for exploring Madrid city.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this trap hotel from Melia, use only as last resort near Barajas airport”
Reviews.Author: HX M
Reviews.Content: I had to spend one night in Barajas to make connection and this was a bad bet. Totally outdated, room had chipped walls, non-working A/C, just terrible for over $150/night. However, it's 5 min from airport, but I'd you can find alternative, take it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miamiajp
Reviews.Content: Typical Melia Hotel, clean, ample rooms, free wifi and good service. About 2-3 miles to the airport, ample parking on the premises. Ordered coffee and pastries in the morning and only hot milk came, when I asked for the coffee, only one cup of coffee was brought up. Other than that, everything was fine. Would stay there again for pre-flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an early morning flight...”
Reviews.Author: 2ridewest
Reviews.Content: Pro's: the rooms are very spacious and clean, the bed was comfy with high quality linen, a deep soaker tub in the bathroom, a full wall of windows for a bright and airy room, good parking right in front of the hotel entrance, and free airport shuttle that runs every 10 minutes. Con's: the outdoor pool was empty and under repair, and there is significant noise from the plumbing in adjacent rooms. Overall, a pretty good hotel if you're looking for something close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just about ok if you need to stay near Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: astronomer-at-large
Reviews.Content: We phoned the hotel from the airport as there was no sign of the bus where they told us it would be, but it turned out to be about 30 metres away, in a bay that was invisble from where it was supposed to be parked. Apart from that, getting there was easy. It then took 15 minutes to check in, although we had booked online and given all required information. It looked as if they were typing in the entire contents of both passports very very slowly. The room was a bit on the cool side because one window latch was broken so window slightly ajar, but there was no obvious method of heating nor any controls. There was a TV, but no list of channels (on-screen list was very hard to use). No tea/coffee making. Bathroom just about ok too. Basin tap very slow; shaving mirror bracket there, but mirror missing. Floor cold marble and a bit unpleasant. The safe could only be used by swiping the room key, but after dark the room lights would only come on with the room key in a device by the door, so we could not use it! Such a bizarre arrangement. We had enough airline food so didn't really need dinner, but we found the restaurant closed anyway. There was no sign on it that might have told us that actually the hotel had another restaurant hidden away in the back (which we found only at breakfast time) that had probably open for dinner. I've stayed in Melia hotels before that were perfectly ok; I guess nobody willingly spends more than one night here so they feel they don't have to bother. Location: under 400m from the Barajas metro station, so would not have been hard to get in to the centre of Madrid, had we not been to tired to do that.

Reviews.Title: “Back to the 70's”
Reviews.Author: Miran_Ali
Reviews.Content: Getting to the hotel is a slog. You have to take the free bus provided by the hotel. But the bus provided by the Hilton was both nicer and the driver better turned out. Check in was fine. The room is massive and perfectly comfortable. The whole place has a cavernous 70's look and feel. The dinner buffet was one of the worst meals I have ever had in Europe. The food was unappetizing and the selection poor. At the price that they charge for the buffet, not worth it at all. The a la carte selection is also not worth considering. So eat at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “OK for airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: Ursosarctos
Reviews.Content: This hotel survives on airport business - aircrew and stranded passengers, for the most part. The building is in good condition, and the room, though on the small side, was quite OK. The public areas are grandiose and not very welcoming. The evening dinner buffet was poor. We were on an inclusive rate, but I would have been appalled if I had been billed the menu price. There was little choice, and the main courses were all dried out over warming-pans. It was not at all the standard we would have expected from a Melia. Despite there being many staff, service was patchy. Don't eat an evening meal here - there is a Hostal across the road which is almost certainly cheaper and more welcoming. The buffet breakfast, on the other hand was brilliant (although we gather from other reviews that the price is eye-watering if billed separately). The shuttle worked OK: but there is nowhere to sit, inside or out, when waiting for the minivan. As it runs on a 20-minute schedule, this might be difficult for some.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Stay Near Barajas”
Reviews.Author: UKbanker33
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a very delayed flight near midnight and grabbed the shuttle...no problem. Very large room and elegant although clearly last rennovated in the mid-1990's. Needs refreshing. Good for an overnight stay near the airport if you get a good rate. Close to public transport if you are stranded and need to go into Madrid, and the town is OK with everything you would expect in a cosmopiltan Spanish suburb. Service formal and a bit cold. Breakfast extortionate...take the subway into Madrid and have a good coffee if you have time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Alessandr078
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, with a nice service to and from the airport. The room was huge, almost a mini apartment and quite cheap. It is also very close to the metro that that takes you to the center. The service was good, the breakfast and lunch just excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Worse place I have been in a while”
Reviews.Author: CletoCleto
Reviews.Content: Very old, the food was terrible friendly staff but too expencive for what it is. The area is not nice at all either. Many nicer hotel in the aerea. Avoid it like a rush!!

Reviews.Title: “Good airport location”
Reviews.Author: dklon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located not very far from Barajas airport, and there is a shuttle bus that runs between the airport and hotel. I found the walls in the room that I was staying in to be very thin - so think I could here the TV from next door and the conversation of the couple. I had an early flight so didn't have the best night's sleep. Reception staff were good. I ate at a small restaurant across the road which was cheap and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: 07LizzyB
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight with my husband on our last night in Europe. We had a large suite that was very roomy and comfortable. I found the traditional decor to be quaint and very European. The bathroom was huge with a separate tub and shower. The hotel airport shuttle was very convenient. Metro stop was close to the hotel for easy access. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient beside airport but basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: Luca_Luo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 1KM from the Madrid Barajas airport. They offered 24 hours free shuttle bus between the hotel and the airport. Around 15 minutes, there will be the shuttle bus and this makes it easy. The shuttle bus stops at every terminal with the sign of "hotel shuttle" on the stop. You should wave to the driver if you see a car coming with the logo "Melia Barajas" on the car or he'll pass by without stopping. I don't know whether this hotel is a 3 star or 4 star. Fairly speaking, the room is very basic and old style. The decoration and the funitures in the room makes it like a grandpa hotel. The television is small and the carpet is in dark color. The bathroom is floor is not that clear. There's no free network available, the internet access is with additional charge. Also, the parking will cost you 16 Euro per day. Most important, the sound proof of the room is terrible. I can clearly hear people talking outside my door. I even heard the water in my neighbour's bathroom, I also heard my neighbour making a phone call.......Don't forget to bring your ear plug if you choose to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good option for an overnight near Barajas airport”
Reviews.Author: nad66
Reviews.Content: Had to stay overnight in Madrid Barajas airport on my way to Mexico. Arrived at 9.15 pm, called the hotel at 10:05 pm, shuttle arrived in 15 minutes and by 10:30 I was already in my room. My room rate was 109 euros/night. when I checked in I was asked if I will leave early in the morning, and where will I eat breakfast, at the restaurant or in my room. I chose the restaurant, when I got into my room and looked at the bill I saw that they add 15 euros for breakfast... I went down and canceled it. They told me that I was given a better room because I ordered breakfast (strange...) but didn't ask me to change rooms. Internet costs 12 euros for 24 hours. If you want to eat something you have to eat at the hotel. food is expensive - a beer and a sandwich costs 20-25 euros. so if you plan to stay for the night, eat dinner, breakfast and use the internet you can come up with 50% more then you expected to spend. Overall it's a very good hotel. Huge rooms. Clean. Close to the airport with a good shuttle service from and to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tom5671
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very much for business and airline crew people. I found it also as a good hotel for private tourist. Located closely to airport (you do not hear airplanes in your room), it is clean and provides bus connection to the airport. Approximately 15 min walk to metro station to pick up line 8 and be in 30 min in downtown Madrid.No internet in the room, but available in common area next to coffee shop.I was happy there. We ate outside the hotel so no comments about dinning inside the hotel. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a 1-night sleep”
Reviews.Author: YanisM
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, near the airport (10' away). frequent conection with own buses. Large and clean rooms. Dinner at the restaurant (buffet) was not very good and a bit expensive, the breakfast though was OK. free wi-fi but not the best signal (form my room 1-2 bars out of 5) very friendly and helpful reception. Overall a possitive experience

Reviews.Title: “Excellent surprise paid for by airline”
Reviews.Author: Moorbius
Reviews.Content: Got caught up in an crazy travel experience in Dec 2010. Got to Gatwick Airport London just as it was closed (3 days!). Got out of Gatwick by last train that got through the snow, just as all the motorways were closed in the area. Got to Heathrow, got one of last seats to Gran Canaria to join Tall Ship Tenacious (Jubilee Sailing Trust) as a volunteer. Plane only got as far as Madrid airport, then the airport baggage staff went on strike. Apparently illegal, the Spanish army 'took over' the airport, causing nearly ALL airport staff to go sick (apparently legal). Needless to say when Iberian Airways offered to put me up overnight for free, I took the offer!!! The hotel was simply fantastic. Very (and I mean very) large rooms, superb bathroom, HUGE foyer, great food, brilliant staff. Great nights sleep in a king bed. Free basic sleeping wear and toiletries. Staff helped with a free early morning transfer to get any available onward flight (the disruption was now Europe wide). Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business facilities for our two-day meeting”
Reviews.Author: Surreyglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated close to the Madrid Barajas airport, which was partly why I was there, spending two days attending meetings in the conference facilties, and staying in the hotel. There is a free shuttle bus to and from the airport, but we took a taxi on arriving in Madrid because the bus driver informed us and the rest of the group waiting it would be another 20-25 minutes, which was too long to wait in the 35+C temperature. The room I stayed in was comfortable and spacious and I found the bathroom to well fitted out. The decor is somewhat dated but the room was clean. I could not get either the wired network connection or the WiFi to work, which was disappointing, although some of my colleagues had more success in their rooms. The lobby area is spacious but the lifts are very small and dark. However there is a wide open stairway you can easily use instead. Breakfast was included in the room rate and the dining room was large and airy and the buffet breakfast had a good selection of hot and cold items, including some that let you know you were definitely in Spain rather than just anywhere in Europe. Staff were polite and friendly. Check-in and check-out was reasonably quick and efficient. We used one of the major conference rooms for two days - facilities were good,with plenty of space, excellent projector screen and power points for laptops for all attendees. The tapas-style buffet lunch was excellent with a great selection of high quality hot and cold items. Overall the hotel had a mix of business and leisure guests, with the families and holiday-makers slightly outnumbering the business guests. This meant that the lobby area was occasionally quite busy with large numbers of tour group guests arriving and departing.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, great buffets, kind service, higly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Debbybcn
Reviews.Content: We had a problem with an Iberian airlines flight and after hours of hassles at the airport with a very disorganized Iberian airlines staff, we were sent to the Melia Barajas hotel. What a welcome change, kind and attentive staff. The lunch, dinner and breakfast buffets were excellent, wonderful waiters and attentive service. Lovely clean rooms, and a free computer in the lobby to use as well. An oasis after trying to deal with the staff of Iberian airlines!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: tpa078
Reviews.Content: Free Airport shuttle vey convienient. about 1/2 KM walk to metro station which is the best way to get around Madrid. Room was adequate and had "fresh" furnishings, bathrooms looked old, but was of nice size and function. No minibar in my room. One complaint, I could hear the TV in the next room all night. I was expecting a bit more from Melia

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jeff1996
Reviews.Content: We were travelling as part of a soccer team group that went on tour in Spain and due to delay's by Iberia we were booked into the hotel overnight by the Airline. I must say they dealt with more than 100 people at 1am in the morning quite efficiently and with the exception of a rude bellboy who insisted on single persons going in one queue and families in another, the checkin process was acceptable. The hotel is a few minutes by bus from the airport so my guess is that it is not suitable if one wants to be in Madrid proper. Dinner was served at 1am in the morning and the hotels restaurant adequately staffed with waiters and wine stewards despite this obscene time. Despite checkin in at this hour, the room was ready for us and a spare bed for hour son ready and made up and the room fridge unlocked and stocked (compliments of Iberia...not bad when travelling economy). The room was large and VERY comfortable. I will probably never stay in this hotel again unless in transit but this is only due to it's location. If I visit Spain again I will however look for other hotels in the same chain.

Reviews.Title: “Schizophenic hotel near Madrid's International Airport”
Reviews.Author: LWL3333
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this airport hotel twice within 2 weeks, since we had flights to and from Madrid's International Airport in Barajas. Co-incidentally we had stayed at this hotel in 1979 before it became affiliated with the Sol/Melia chain and we remembered it as being located near the entrance of the airport. The free shuttle bus to and from the airport was a big help to us. The first stay was great. We were upgraded to a superior room without even asking. The price/value ratio was very good. I had joined Melia's Mas frequent stay program before we arrived, so that qualified us for 2 for 1 breakfasts which saved us about $18. We were treated like royalty by the reception desk. The room was large and clean. The bathroom was marble with 2 sinks, a bidet, a bath tub and separate shower. Breakfast was a large and tasty buffet with many choices. On our second visit it was like a different hotel. The room was the same size and configuration (on this stay we paid about $25 more for a superior room). The reception personnel couldn't have cared less that we were back, or even that we were alive. No smiles. We were not offered the 2 for 1 breakfast option. Our room had several cellophane wrappers and the tear strip from a lady's sanitary napkin on the floor. On this visit we ate dinner in the hotel's restaurant, and I have hardly ever had such a poor excuse for a meal. We paid about $47 each for the dinner buffet. Within a half hour the food had run out and nothing was replenished for the next 30 minutes. The food was not hot but everything was overcooked nonetheless. We left hungry and feeling that we had been taken advantage of. From the looks on the faces of the other patrons that night, there were many who felt the same way. The only positive thing was that at about 6 PM room service delivered 2 small bottles of Rioja red wine, dried fruits and an assortment of nuts, compliments of the management.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: spiralisis
Reviews.Content: landed at night to travel the following evening and wanted somewhere near the airport to sleep then leave our luggage for the day to quickly see Madrid before flying off again. This hotel has a shuttle service from the airport, clean quiet nicely decorated rooms, and a bar and restaurant on the ground floor. it is walking distance to newsagents, restaurants and a burger king, as well as 5min walk from the metro which you can take directly into the city. ideal for short stops, there is even a pillow menu for you to choose from in order to get a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great location, met all our needs, and was fairly priced.”
Reviews.Author: ship-11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights. Our room was very nice, spacious and clean.. Mattress was FIRM and the pillows long and THIN.(needed two, which they provided). The free shuttle to the hotel and airport was very efficient. The location was in a safe neighborhood and the walk to the metro (station Barajas) took 10 minutes. Free internet service was available and the staff helpful. We did find the restaurant prices very high, but with a small convenience store within 5 minutes that situation was resolved. Would stay there again and would recommend to friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, close to airport but a fair way from town center”
Reviews.Author: yossmitesam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in the Melia Barajas having booked tickets to see Spurs in the Champions league-very easy getting tickets to the Bernabeu. A free shuttle bus runs regularly from the airport to the hotel and back which was easy and only took 10mins. Check in was smooth and friendly, good english spoken and lots of advice, tips and a map as it was our first trip to madrid. We did not eat at the hotel so no comment on food, but a few restaurants and bars within a few min walk of hotel. Metro stop was a 10min walk and the underground is incredibly easy & cheap to use, 1 euro gets you anywhere! We bought a block of 10trips for 9.3 euros which lasted 4 days. To get to Sol-the main town area took about 40mins from our hotel, but was no big deal as once we were there each day we stayed. Madrid is a fantastic city with lots to do and see, we did 2 english walking tours, visited the Prado(free after 6pm!), the botanical gardens and parks, good food and drink and loads going on untill the small hours. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for those wanting to be near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Arale N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after my flight was cancelled. The airline chose this hotel which I found quite convenient. They have a free shutle running every 15 minutes from the hotel to the airport. Their rooms are small but comfortable. I liked their beds, the shower had appropriate water preasure and heating was fine (I washed my clothes in the evening and left them and on the radiator and they were dry at 5am). Buffet dinner was ok. I couldn't taste breakfast for I left to early, but they were kind enough to leave coffee and croissant at the bar for those leaving early

Reviews.Title: “just don't use the phone...”
Reviews.Author: Mary-Isa
Reviews.Content: Hello! I stayed one night last january in the hotel Excellent accomodations, delicious breakfast, and really convenient if you are between flights. But BEWARE!!! Don't even think in making phone calls! I called 2 numbers in Madrid, and was charged 6 euros / minute. That's right, you read correctly - 6 euros / minute for local calls. The 2 calls costed me 35% of the rate I payed. See you!

Reviews.Title: “Too dusty and old”
Reviews.Author: JohannaGuerrero
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, cleaning is the most important thing about a hotel, especially if we are talking about a quite expensive four star hotel like this. The room I was accomodated in was dusty as if it wasn't cleaned for months, there were someone's footprints on the wall, a pubic hair in the bidet and rust on the bathtube. To top it all off, when I took a bottle of water from the minibar it was already opened and filled with water from the tap. Well, I understand that it was the fault of the previous guest, but houskeeping should has checked the minibar. To say something good: the food in the restaurant was really delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Super Airport Option”
Reviews.Author: oesrn
Reviews.Content: Drove from Portugal to Madrid and arrived at night without a reservation. We were able to get a large room for our family of 5 with a room right next door for my in-laws. Friendly service at the front desk. Comfortable and nicely decorated. Loved the large bathroom! Breakfast buffet was a bit pricey and nothing special, but service was good. Perfect place to stay for easy airport access.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Time in a Bottle”
Reviews.Author: McGunn
Reviews.Content: All I can say is GO THERE! The hotel is all original mahogany with beautiful etchings along the hallways. The room is original mahogany beds and dressers with the most beautiful marble bathrooms. Visit the bar with the most outstanding expresso machine in the world made of solid copper. The staff is amazing and speak english with the most helpful attitude in the world. The free breakfast consists of fresh breads, fresh seafood, fruits and a variety of meats and egg dishes. I only hope I can return before they get caught up in the Holiday Inn mentality. It is fresh, original and spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Food was very expensive.”
Reviews.Author: GranburyTexaslady
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be very nice. However, there was not an exercise room. Also, the information about the prices of the food was non existent. The waiter told us the food was included in our price. Yet, at the end of the dinner, the head waiter (we presume) approached us with a bill for a buffet we could not even eat much of...a bill of 47 Euros, about $70 in US money. The other problem was communication. The staff was very limited English-speaking. Be sure to ask about a room including meals, or at least ask for the prices of the food. ...if you are on a budget, as we were. The free shuttle to the airport was nice, but then all the hotels in Madrid have a free shuttle to the airport. Stay somewhere downtown and enjoy the city more easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....20 years ago!”
Reviews.Author: luru
Reviews.Content: I am sure that the Melia Barajas used to be a great hotel, but years ago They do have a 24h airport shuttle, free of charge which was really nice. Unfortunately for me , the suttle was completely full so I had to wait 1/2 hour to finally check in. The room has nice furniture, but everything is VERY OLD There were multiple big HOLES in the wall and HOLES in the sheets and pillows. The painting of the walls was full of stains and other marks. The shower cabin was the worst part: There was mold all over it! The white silicone had turned black! The walls are very thin so I could hear my neighbours entering their room around 3 am, not very nice. I've stayed in better youth hostels, the Melia Barajas is definitely not up to a 4* standard. It is simply to expensive for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: joabla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 4*, but its quality is slightly less, probably a 3*. Overall is not bad. Rooms are spacious and relatively new. Staff is quite lousy, which seems to be a characteristic of all Melia, Sol and Tryp hotels. Breakfast is, simply, terrible, considering you are supposed to be at a 4* and that the price is around 20 euros

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight layover. Free 24-hour airport shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler515
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is not close to downtown Madrid and you'll have to change metro lines at least twice to get downtown. Watch out for pick-pockets on the trains. We stayed here one night to catch an early flight the next morning. We took the metro into downtown for the afternoon/evening. The staff helped us find the station and figure out which lines we needed to take. The 24-hour airport shuttle was very convenient, but it fills up quickly in the morning, so be ready early. I wouldn't pick this hotel for a long visit to Madrid, but it works for a quick stop requiring easy airport access. Rooms and bathrooms are very large, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room. Great Breakfast. Allow time for shuttle to airport.”
Reviews.Author: Momma_J_StL
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for last night of trip to Spain due to free shuttle to airport. Room was large with extra area with desk. Would be an excellent hotel for business. Has large bathroom with tub AND walk-in showers. Outside of hotel a bit run down (needs new sidewalks). Inside lovely. Able to walk short distance to area with lots of eating options for dinner. Pool looked nice, but we got in too late to enjoy it. Breakast buffet was huge with variety of food (included in price of our room). We were not allowed on the first airptort shuttle that arrived - for flight staff only. Second shuttle droped us at the airport, but then we needed to find another shuttle to get to the correct terminal. Not sure if the Melia shuttle only drops in one location or not. Walked around terminal for a while before figuring out we were in the wrong place. Would have been nice if Melia shuttle would have explained more about where it was dropping you off. Luckily, we had time to get lost and take a long shuttle to the other terminal (there are 4).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDMHaddonfield_NJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia Barajas the night before returning home to the US. After staying in tourist class hotels, this felt like a big splurge though the price was very reasonable. The room was large as was the bathroom which had two sinks, a toilet, bidet, shower and tub/shower. The air conditioning worked well. They even had a "pillow menu" with several different types of pillows. I was really surprised when about five minutes after ordering a feather pillow, a hotel employee arrived at my door. For some reason in all the other hotels, I had a long sausage shaped pillow, and I was glad to have a regular one. The hotel is located about ten minutes from the Barajas metro stop - turn right and keep walking until you see it. Unlike other airport hotels, Barajas appears to be a section of Madrid and we walked to a convenience store. I was told that a steak restaurant a couple of blocks away was very good. The bar was very comfortable and I had dinner and a small breakfast there. I did not reserve the breakfast included package. My only regret is that I missed the the Spanish soccer team who had stayed there the previous two nights after winning the World Cup!.

Reviews.Title: “So good. For less than most budget type...”
Reviews.Author: Mark_J_G
Reviews.Content: So good. For less than most budget type hotels, this is an old school hotel of the best sort. It's clean, the rooms are amazing and spacious, staff very friendly. What more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, nice garden with big Swimming Pool”
Reviews.Author: MiguelReis
Reviews.Content: The location is great, if you arrive by plane to Madrid. Near the hotel is a metro station to down town. Also a good bus connection to Avenida de America directly in the front of the hotel. It is quiet, nice garden with a big swimming pool (25 m). Good breakfast. Nice and kindly employees. Not expecting too much, I liked it. The building is not new, but it is good enough. Air conditioning in the whole hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: EWLTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our last night in Spain in May, 2010, here before flying out the next day and found it to be the perfect place to stay……frequent shuttles to the airport and large, quiet, cool, comfortable, well appointed rooms at a great price that included breakfast. We originally considered the Airport Hilton, but were appalled by the price…more than most other places we stayed while in Spain. Great hotel for those who want to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with reasonable rates, spacious and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: maggieferrua
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by the size of the room and luxurious bathroom, with shower, tub, bidet and 2 sinks. Transportation to and from Barajas airport was good, we did not have to wait more than a couple of minutes for the shuttle. We ordered room service and the food was good and abundant. Very good value for your money, wil stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Europrob
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in April and only have good things to say. The room was very spacious and clean. The room was very lkarge and well appointed.The staff was helpful and truly hospitable without being obsequious. The breakfast buffet was lavish with something for every taste. Spanish pastries are really great. The hotel is only 5 minutes from the airport with frequent shuttle service. The metro is only a few blocks away. my stay was extremely pleasant with no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: unspecified
Reviews.Content: This is not quite a standard review, since I ended up in this hotel during an unplanned stop in Madrid due to the Icelandic volcano cancelling my flight, and this being one of Iberia's standard hotels near the airport. But that doesn't stop me being very impressed with this hotel. The room looked a bit tatty - scratched paintwork and woodwork, but was nevertheless grand. A spacious and clean bathroom was fine, and the bed gave a very comfortable night's sleep, and had the rather innovative idea of a single, double-bed-width pillow. Free wifi around the hotel was of a high quality and very welcome. Food in the restaurant, despite being a buffet for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, was of an exceptionally high quality, and the service by all staff, despite the very difficult circumstances they were working under, was exemplary. The town of Barajas itself is fairly uninteresting, but you're about 700m from the Barajas metro station to get you into the centre of Madrid within 30 minutes. Alternatively, a bus to the airport takes about 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel by the Barajas Airport”
Reviews.Author: myosotis
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel and highly recommend it. The shuttle service from the airport was quick and efficient. Staff at the reception were nice and professional, so was the room service (I had a great salad!). The hotel is very clean and nicely furnished. My room was new, clean, quiet, comfortable bed, had free internet. The bathroom was large and clean. If you want to get dinner or breakfast, there are plenty of options around the hotel, because it's in the town of Barajas. I'd highly recommend this place if you need to stay in the vicinities of the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michele H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location, very close to the airport. We only had to wait 5-10 minutes for the shuttle to arrive at the airport upon arrival. The room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. In addition, the metro station was a short 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay near the Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: bdjwc
Reviews.Content: If you need to get to the airport early this is definitely the place to stay. It has 24 hour airport shuttle service. The room was surprisingly beautiful and elegant. The breakfast was superb. The hotel is elegant and the staff very professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Dumped here at 4am by Iberia. Nice enough hotel though”
Reviews.Author: cheyrou23
Reviews.Content: Like others here we were dumped here by Iberia after being bumped off a flight. 5min shuttle bus ride from the airport (it's nearer than that but you have to go round some one-way nonsense). Far better than I was expecting. Clean, large rooms with everything I'd expect. Wouldn't have stayed here in a million years but then I'm not in the habit of looking for 4-star hotels near airports. For business or similar it would be fine. Breakfast was a large buffet. The 'English Breakfast' looked pretty nasty made up of cooked strips of ham and frankfurters, but if I wanted English Breakfast I'd have stayed at home. Good cakes, bread, cereal and juices and a nice dining room. Staff were as helpful as you could hope for at 4am. It doesn't feel like you're at an airport hotel, the surrounding area just looks like a Madrid suburb but we didn't have time to venture out.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again - ever”
Reviews.Author: go-okay
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as an overnight stay before flying back to the United States the next morning. Despite having checked before departure, the hotel had booked four rooms instead of two for our group of four. They also had the incorrect price. Fortunately, the person who booked the hotel had the email confirmation showing the correct number of rooms and the agreed price. We ate in the dining room because of the late hour. One person ordered the white chocolate mousse with raspberry sauce and got chocolate cake instead. How can anyone mistake one for the other!!! It was corrected. We mistakenly charged the meal to the room, and when one of the party took part of the ticket as a receipt, they were chased into and confronted by the waiter in the lobby. That person informed the waiter that she was not leaving without a receipt of the transaction, so that she could compare it with the bill upon checkout. She got a receipt after a heated exchange in Spanish. Upon checkout, it was discovered that someone had charged over 100 euros in bar charges to one of our rooms!! Need I tell you that at after 10:00 pm, we were all ready to go to bed in order to get up for early morning flights. Thank goodness, "everything wrong" was only for one night. Oh yes, it also helped that one person in our group was relatively fluent in Spanish, as some of the key contact staff did not seem to know or want to "try" to speak English. This experience could have been a vacation "buster", but fortunately, the rest of our vacation and other hotels were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: poidog7
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel. Excellent bed (not too soft nor too hard with great pillows). Room is elegant with abundant use of marble tiles in the bathroom. Separate tub and shower stall in the bathroom. There was free wireless in the lobby as well as my room on the first floor. There was an ethernet jack in the room but it didn't work for me. Just as well as they charge for use of the ethernet jack. Arrived late (11:30PM). Only option for eating was the dinner buffet. Not good at all, with wilted salads and over cooked fish for 32 euros (bottle of wine and bottle of water included). Shuttle bus service was excellent. Called the hotel to make sure about the shuttle bus and had no problem getting it even late in the evening. It arrived promptly. Shuttle to the airport in the morning was right on time (seems to run every 30 minutes). Stayed for 2 nights and was very satisfied (except for the buffet). Options for eating in the residential neighborhood surrounding the hotel but nothing special. Front desk was helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay when leaving through the airport”
Reviews.Author: TwoLaneRoads
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel from the Melia chain that you will see all over the world. There is no reason not to stay. I am not sure if you would want to be here more than a night since it is far outside the center of Madrid. It is close to the airport (10 minutes). I was there on a Friday night and there were few guests. One suggestion is that you bring any adapters you need for any electric applicance (must be able to use 220 V) because the outlets in the rooms are all European with two round holes. My suitcase with my adapters had been lost and I asked the hotel for one, but the desk clerk could not help. They have none! That is a big mistake for an international hotel, in my opinion. Some little negatives - no clock in room, no business room (two free Internet computers in lounge with loud piano lounge music), food is very good, but the casual area is out in the bar/lobby and not at all cozy or quiet. I did not try the formal dining room. There are good taxis outside and a free bus to and from the airport every hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel with things nearby to explore”
Reviews.Author: hnewburn
Reviews.Content: I usually hate airport hotels because there's nothing to do around them. However, the Melia has a fairly extensive neighborhood around it with lots of little bars and restaurants. I went to Barajas 5 and had some very good pork. The airport bus was very convenient and fast the two times I used it, just call +34 917 477 700 and tell them you've arrived. The check-in process was a little lengthy. I got room service and it was pretty good. There's not much to the mini-bar, but there's room in the fridge for your own things. The bed was comfortable, but just had one big body pillow, which was a pain to wrestle sometimes. There was only wired ethernet, but you can borrow a cable from them. All-in-all, one of the better airport hotels. Metro is nearby, transportation to the airport is easy, you'll enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge by the outside!”
Reviews.Author: Degas
Reviews.Content: Just a one nighter whilst attending a medical conference at nearby centre - must admit to a little heartsink as the cab drew into the hotel - but once settled in my room -everything was fine. The decor is classic spanish with lots of carved wood and rich color and my room was very spacious with a great armchair with foot stool which was perfect for reading. Had a little hiccup when the wirless internet went down - but they managed to get it working again within the hour and even bothered to call and let me know. Saw a good sized pool through the window which would have been nice earleir in the year. The staff were very good - helpful at getting a cab at the crack of dawn - be happy to stay there again if I wanted to be near the airport

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near the Airport. Free Shuttle to Airport”
Reviews.Author: twah
Reviews.Content: I stayed here upon returning from Barcelona prior to our transatlantic flight home. I have stayed at a Melia in Puerto Vallarta Mexico and enjoyed the experience so I thought I would try the Melia Barajas. I upgraded to the "executive" level and thought that it was worth it. The room was very nice and decorated in a classical manner. It was as large a nice hotel room in the United States which is unusual for Europe. The bathroom was all marble with a tub and a shower. There was a very comfortable king sized bed. They are doing their own version of the "heavenly bed" and it was quite good. They even had a "pillow menu" you could selectr from. We must have been lucky because I called the hotel upon our arrival at the airport and within 5 minutes the shuttle was there to pick us up. This has never happened before in all my travelling experience. The return trip to the airport was just as prompt although you do stop at their sister hotel the Tryp to pick up passengers. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Huge and nice room close to the airport a little bit far from Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jmfh
Reviews.Content: I was there for work, I didn't need to go to Madrid and my workplace was very close to the hotel, then I avoid the big traffic jams in order to enter Madrid in the morning or leaving Madrid in the evenings. The hotel is functional it means it has no special appeal or motivation to go there. You can find a subway station 10 minutes by feed to get Madrid. The room was very nice, well decorated, with all the facilities that you expect in a hotel of this level. Nice bathroom with shower and bath tube. Few international free TV channels but free Internet. The breakfast was strictly ok even there was a great quantity of choices; I didn’t have any other meal there. The staff was correct.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were nice but restaurant food was appalling”
Reviews.Author: batgirl13uk
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in Madrid after missing a connecting flight and were put up here for the night. The rooms were fine but dinner was awful; lukewarm and inedible main courses and the salad was all tinned vegetables except for the wilted lettuce. Their "fresh, handmade pastries" were the sort of cheap generic cakes you find at old cornershops that were stale. Breakfast was nicer as there was an abundance of fresh fruit and fresh fruitjuice, though I would not pay to stay or eat there myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oyabe
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all on this site who recommended this place! You were right:! Very high quality hotel, excellent. Check-in at the reception was efficient and professional, and the staff speaks good English. After a long, exhausting day, what a joy to walk into our beautiful room! When you 1st enter, there's a whole separate entryway area with furniture/closet just to store your luggage. From there, you walk into the actual room and notice how spacious it is. Separate area/alcove with a desk/writing table and sitting area, etc. The bathroom was gorgeous with separate shower and bath, huge, fluffy thick towels on a towel warmer, marble counters, etc. Immaculately clean. Other definite pluses: Free internet in the lobby area, and 24 hour free shuttle to the airport which is just 5 minutes away. We had to be taken the next morning to the airport at 4:45am, and the shuttle was right on time. This hotel may be a bit more than some other airport hotels, but definitely worth the price. (139 euros). Save yourself time and stress and stay here if you need a good airport hotel. Also, thanks to the person who recommended on this site a nearby restaurant called "Al Traste", only 3 blocks away. It's like Appleby's, very reasonable prices and good food. They have a menu in English too. The BBQ ribs and chocolate brownie dessert were delicious!(Go 1 block east, then 2 blocks north).

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: wrantar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, friendly, efficient, modern. Nice room with all the services you would expect in an airport location. Dinner in the dining room and selected the buffet, and I would have to say this is one of the best meals I've ever had at an "airport" hotel. I have seen more lavish buffets at big city or resort five-star hotels but I have not had higher quality or better tasting food. The poached salmon was the best salmon I remember eating, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: travelerbar
Reviews.Content: What I liked most about this hotel was the ample room and bathroom. Nice decor and comfortable bed. Also, the meals were good, as was the table service. The people at the reception did not seem to me particularly friendly, just correct. The location is nice and convenient, because you are close to the airport (they have a free shuttle service) and at the same time the subway station is a few blocks away. Mind you, the subway takes you to the city centre very easily, even though you have to transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.... not so good in the restaurant or pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an unscheduled night in Madrid following the disastrous and appalling service by Iberia Airlines. We were put up at the Hotel Gran Melia Barajas and toughly enjoyed it. The hotel is clean and tidy and very attractive inside and out. The rooms are very nice, Edwardian style, clean and well equipped. It can get hot in the room if you touch the air-con. Service is ok – what you’d expect from a city hotel. The hotel is nice although slightly expensive…. It is much cheaper across the road from the hotel. Don’t choose the a-la-carte menu for dinner, as it’s not that good at all…. We found the food all very fatty and cold. Breakfast ok – again pretty standard for a city hotel. The pool is dirty and the gardens with the lounger’s full of ants! Be careful and always wear shoes outside….

Reviews.Title: “Excellnet hotel”
Reviews.Author: melofun
Reviews.Content: The Melia Barajas is excellent and beautiful hotel near the airport, and close from the city in the metro the people there are very nice, and try to help, the room was big and clean, really very good, the hotel lobby is very pretty, and the prize was good too We have a king size bed and we have enough space Thank to the nice people who working at Melia Barajas, If we know them what we know now, we will stay there better the stay in the tryp Washington, but we don't know about the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Howard S
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Melia Barajas before returning home from vacation. We found the room to be very nicely decorated and very clean. Compares well with a Marriott-class business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: unicorns
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night before heading back to the States - it was great! Beautiful bathroom, great amenities, a real queen bed instead of two twins put together, and very upscale and elegant decor. The free airport shuttle was very convenient. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, very close to airport.”
Reviews.Author: NYBob6
Reviews.Content: Call from the airport and they send a free shuttle to pick you up. The hotel is quite large. Rooms are very spacious. Bathroom was immaculate. Not cheap, but huge breakfast was included with the fee. If you have to stay near the airport, this is a wonderful place. (I was there in May, 2005.) .

Reviews.Title: “A 4-5 star hotel indeed!”
Reviews.Author: G_Explorer
Reviews.Content: Our flight was overbooked, so our airline booked this hotel for us. The service was great. The location is around the airport though, which is about 25 Euros taxi to main centre (Puerta Del Sol) Madrid. The room was elegant, large and very clean. The dinner and breakfast buffets were delicious. Lots of TV channels. There is a computer available and the internet is free. The interior design is beautiful - yellow/red carpet with cherry wood walls and furniture. There is a shuttle to the airport. The hotel is well suited for business men/women. I would highly recommend this hotel around the airport area. If you are in Madrid for the main attractions though, the location of this hotel is not ideal!

HotelInfo.Name: Melia Barajas
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida De Logrono 305, 28042 Madrid, Spain
